page.title: 01UDIMORE
page.content: Our grid reference takes in about three quarters of the village of Udimore,plus some farm-land on its Western boundary. Our remarks will therefore be mainly devoted to Udimore itself. It is a very long village, really consisting of several separate settlements strung out along the ridge between the Brede and Tillingham valleys. In the whole village there are 324 people, with a high proportion of elderly people. We are part of a designated 'Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty' and certainly there are some wonderful views across both valleys.We are three miles from the market town of Rye and twelve from Hastings, the major town of the area. It is said that we are the second longest village in England, Stukely in Buckinghamshire being the first.
